Package model

Class UserFlashcards

java.lang.Object
model.UserFlashcards
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class UserFlashcards extends Object implements Serializable
Contains an ArrayList which stores flashcards. The ArrayList can be manipulated in ways of adding, editing and removing flashcards from the array. In terms of the GUI, this is the model that will be manipulated.
Since:
0.1
Version:
0.2
Author:
Max Harris, MaxHarrisMJH@gmail.com
See Also:
Serialized Form

      Initialises the ArrayList of type Flashcard.

  • Method Details

    • addFlashcard

      public void addFlashcard​(Flashcard flashcard)
      Allows the user to add a new flashcard to the ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      flashcard - The user's flashcard.

    • addSubject

      public void addSubject​(Subject subject)
      Allows the user to add a new subject to the ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      subject - The subject type of the flashcard.

    • editFlashcard

      public void editFlashcard​(Flashcard flashcard, String flashcardTitle, String flashcardText, String flashcardImageURL, Subject subject)
      Allows the user to edit an existing flashcard from the ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      flashcard - The flashcard that the user intends to edit.
      flashcardTitle - The title of the flashcard.
      flashcardText - The text of the flashcard.
      subject - The subject of the flashcard.

    • editSubject

      public void editSubject​(Subject oldSubject, String newSubject)

    • removeFlashcard

      public void removeFlashcard​(Flashcard flashcard)
      Allows the user to remove a flashcard from the ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      flashcard - The flashcard that the user wishes to delete.

    • removeSubject

      public void removeSubject​(Subject subject)
      Allows the user to remove a subject from the ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      subject - The subject that the user wishes to delete.

    • size

      public int size()
      Gets the size of the ArrayList.
      Returns:
      An integer which represents the size of the ArrayList.

    • getFlashcards

      public List<Flashcard> getFlashcards()
      Gets the list of all flashcards in the ArrayList.
      Returns:
      All the flashcards within the ArrayList.

    • getFlashcard

      public Flashcard getFlashcard​(int index)
      Gets a flashcard at a specific index from the ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the flashcard.
      Returns:
      A flashcard if the index is within the ArrayList bounds or null.

    • getFlashcard

      public Flashcard getFlashcard​(String flashcardTitle, Subject currentSubject)
      Gets a flashcard from the ArrayList by passing a flashcard title and subject.
      Parameters:
      flashcardTitle - The title of the flashcard.
      currentSubject - The subject that the flashcard belongs to.
      Returns:
      A flashcard with the specified title and subject or null.

    • getSubjects

      public List<Subject> getSubjects()
      Gets the list of all subjects in the ArrayList.
      Returns:
      All the subjects within the ArrayList.
